lively.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone who is lively has a lot of energy and is very active
lively.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a place or situation that is lively is exciting because a lot of things are happening
lively.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The hotel is situated next to the lively bustling port.
lively.translation[0].definitions[2].def: lively movements or music are very quick and exciting
lively.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a lively discussion, description etc is very interesting and involves a lot of ideas
lively.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The book offers a lively account of her travels.
a lively debate on environmental issues
lively.translation[0].definitions[4].def: someone who has a lively mind is intelligent and interested in a lot of things
lively.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Even Paula has shown a lively interest in politics.
Charlie has a very lively imagination  (=he often invents stories, descriptions etc that are not true).
lively.translation[0].definitions[6].def: something that has a lively taste has a strong but pleasant taste
lively.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: The wine has a lively fruity flavour.
lively.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if trading on the stock market is lively, people are buying and selling a lot of stocks, shares etc
lively.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: In Milan, trading was lively for the first time in weeks.
